channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Secretary of State Rubio and Denmark will meet to discuss U.S. interest in Greenland
item.description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said he plans to meet with Danish officials next week after the Trump administration doubled down on its intention...

item.title: The Custom Quote Is a Lie Service Businesses Tell Themselves
item.description: I tracked 5,500 service businesses and $30 million in transactions. What I found is surprising.

item.title: Before AI Can Answer Your Questions, Someone Has to Train It
item.description: Scale AI, Surge AI, and the billion-dollar gig-work industry shaping everything from chatbots to self-driving cars.

item.title: Google and Character.AI agree to settle lawsuits over teen suicides linked to AI chatbots
item.description: The cases include claims that a chatbot engaged a 14-year-old in sexualized conversations before his death and encouraged another teen to harm his par...

item.title: CES 2026: Uncomfortable truths facing media and marketing
item.description: As CES 2026 gets underway, Havas Media Network North America is publishing its 2026 Predictions Forecast, outlining the forces we believe will define ...

item.title: Your dog’s dinner might have a bigger impact on the climate than your own
item.description: Dog owners have a lot of choices nowadays when it comes to picking out pet food for their pup. Dry kibble or wet? Beef or chicken? Frozen, fresh, or r...

item.title: Google Just Announced Major AI Changes to Gmail. Here’s What’s Coming
item.description: Get ready for the AI Inbox, which aims to be like a ‘chief of staff in your life.’

item.title: U.S. is withdrawing from 66 international organizations, Trump memo reveals
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that the United States would withdraw from dozens of international and U.N. entities, including a key cl...

item.title: State Department suspends all U.S. aid to Somalia, citing ‘zero-tolerance policy for waste, theft, and diversion of life-saving assistance’
item.description: The suspension comes as the Trump administration has ratcheted up criticism of Somali refugees and migrants in the United States.

item.title: A Leading Business Writer Says Luck is Important, But This Matters Even More
item.description: Sure, it’s great to be lucky… but what really matters is your return on luck.

item.title: Tesla’s vote wasn’t about pay. It was about who really runs the company
item.description: At Tesla’s 2025 Annual Meeting, investors chose to evaluate strategy, incentives, and governance on their own terms.

item.title: LinkedIn’s Rising Jobs Report Shows the Promise—and Limits—of AI
item.description: Many of the roles still require a human touch.

item.title: Renee Nicole Good merch quickly spreads on Amazon and Etsy just hours after Minneapolis shooting
item.description: Less than 24 hours after the horrifying shooting of a woman by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agent in Minneapolis, merchandise related ...

item.title: Leading the agentic enterprise: What the next wave of AI demands from CEOs
item.description: With agentic AI on board, companies must rethink their very makeup: how work is designed, how decisions are made, and how value is created.

item.title: Nonprofits are solving 21st century problems—they need 21st century tech
item.description: Every once in a while, history presents us with moments that demand a fundamental shift in approach. This is one of those moments.
